issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for SARC Implementation
issues.description: While the Board Policy establishes the framework for School Accountability Report Cards, there is no Administrative Regulation to provide detailed implementation procedures. This creates a significant gap in operational guidance for staff responsible for preparing, reviewing, and disseminating SARCs, potentially leading to inconsistent compliance with state requirements.

legal_citations.text: Requires specific procedures for SARC preparation, content requirements, timelines, and dissemination methods that need detailed implementation guidance beyond policy-level direction.

issues.required_language: An Administrative Regulation should be developed to include: detailed procedures for data collection and verification; specific content requirements and formatting standards; timeline for preparation and review process; methods for ensuring accuracy of reported data; procedures for Board approval process; specific dissemination methods and notification requirements; language accessibility provisions; and procedures for addressing data corrections or updates.

issues.title: Missing Language Accessibility Requirements
issues.description: Neither the policy nor regulation addresses requirements for providing SARCs in languages other than English for communities with significant non-English speaking populations, which is required under federal and state accessibility laws.

legal_citations.text: School districts must ensure meaningful access to school information for parents with limited English proficiency, which includes translation of SARCs when required by federal civil rights laws.

issues.required_language: The district shall provide SARCs in languages other than English when required by federal civil rights laws, including when the district serves a significant number of parents who speak a language other than English. Translation requirements shall be determined based on district demographics and federal guidance.

issues.title: Missing Specific Content Requirements
issues.description: The policy references using the state template but does not specify the mandatory content elements required by Education Code, creating risk of non-compliance with specific reporting requirements.

legal_citations.text: Specifies mandatory content including student achievement data, school conditions, teacher qualifications, curriculum information, and other required elements that must be included in every SARC.

issues.required_language: Each SARC shall include all content required by Education Code Section 35256, including but not limited to: student achievement data by grade and subject; school safety and climate information; teacher and staff qualification data; curriculum and instructional materials information; school facilities conditions; and other elements specified in current state requirements.

issues.title: Outdated Policy Date
issues.description: The policy was last updated in 2009, which predates significant changes to SARC requirements and state accountability systems. While not a legal compliance issue, this suggests the policy may not reflect current best practices or recent statutory changes.

legal_citations.text: SARC requirements have been updated multiple times since 2009, including changes related to new accountability systems and reporting requirements.

issues.required_language: Policy should be reviewed and updated to ensure alignment with current Education Code requirements and state guidance for SARC preparation and dissemination.
